<a id="AudioEffectPitchShift"></a>

# AudioEffectPitchShift

**Inherits:** [AudioEffect](AudioEffect.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Adds a pitch-shifting audio effect to an audio bus.

Raises or lowers the pitch of original sound.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Allows modulation of pitch independently of tempo. All frequencies can be increased/decreased with minimal effect on transients.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Audio buses](../tutorials/audio/audio_buses.md)

## Enumerations

<a id="enum_AudioEffectPitchShift_FFTSize"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **FFTSize**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_AudioEffectPitchShift_FFTSize)

<a id="AudioEffectPitchShift_constant_FFT_SIZE_256"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FFTSize](AudioEffectPitchShift.md#enum_AudioEffectPitchShift_FFTSize) **FFT_SIZE_256** = `0`

Use a buffer of 256 samples for the Fast Fourier transform. Lowest latency, but least stable over time.<a id="AudioEffectPitchShift_constant_FFT_SIZE_512"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FFTSize](AudioEffectPitchShift.md#enum_AudioEffectPitchShift_FFTSize) **FFT_SIZE_512** = `1`

Use a buffer of 512 samples for the Fast Fourier transform. Low latency, but less stable over time.<a id="AudioEffectPitchShift_constant_FFT_SIZE_1024"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FFTSize](AudioEffectPitchShift.md#enum_AudioEffectPitchShift_FFTSize) **FFT_SIZE_1024** = `2`

Use a buffer of 1024 samples for the Fast Fourier transform. This is a compromise between latency and stability over time.<a id="AudioEffectPitchShift_constant_FFT_SIZE_2048"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FFTSize](AudioEffectPitchShift.md#enum_AudioEffectPitchShift_FFTSize) **FFT_SIZE_2048** = `3`

Use a buffer of 2048 samples for the Fast Fourier transform. High latency, but stable over time.<a id="AudioEffectPitchShift_constant_FFT_SIZE_4096"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FFTSize](AudioEffectPitchShift.md#enum_AudioEffectPitchShift_FFTSize) **FFT_SIZE_4096** = `4`

Use a buffer of 4096 samples for the Fast Fourier transform. Highest latency, but most stable over time.<a id="AudioEffectPitchShift_constant_FFT_SIZE_MAX"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FFTSize](AudioEffectPitchShift.md#enum_AudioEffectPitchShift_FFTSize) **FFT_SIZE_MAX** = `5`

Represents the size of the [FFTSize](AudioEffectPitchShift.md#enum_AudioEffectPitchShift_FFTSize) enum.<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="AudioEffectPitchShift_property_fft_size"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[FFTSize](AudioEffectPitchShift.md#enum_AudioEffectPitchShift_FFTSize) **fft_size** = `3` [ðŸ”—](#AudioEffectPitchShift_property_fft_size)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_fft_size**\ (\ value\: [FFTSize](AudioEffectPitchShift.md#enum_AudioEffectPitchShift_FFTSize)\ )
- [FFTSize](AudioEffectPitchShift.md#enum_AudioEffectPitchShift_FFTSize) **get_fft_size**\ (\ )

The size of the [Fast Fourier transform](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fast_Fourier_transform) buffer. Higher values smooth out the effect over time, but have greater latency. The effects of this higher latency are especially noticeable on sounds that have sudden amplitude changes.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AudioEffectPitchShift_property_oversampling"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **oversampling** = `4` [ðŸ”—](#AudioEffectPitchShift_property_oversampling)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_oversampling**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_oversampling**\ (\ )

The oversampling factor to use. Higher values result in better quality, but are more demanding on the CPU and may cause audio cracking if the CPU can't keep up.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AudioEffectPitchShift_property_pitch_scale"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **pitch_scale** = `1.0` [ðŸ”—](#AudioEffectPitchShift_property_pitch_scale)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_pitch_scale**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_pitch_scale**\ (\ )

The pitch scale to use. ``1.0`` is the default pitch and plays sounds unaffected. [pitch_scale](AudioEffectPitchShift.md#AudioEffectPitchShift_property_pitch_scale) can range from ``0.0`` (infinitely low pitch, inaudible) to ``16`` (16 times higher than the initial pitch).
